questions.question: Which of the following is a state function?
questions.explanation: Internal energy is a state function; it depends only on the state of the system, not the path.

questions.question: Explain why heat and work are not state functions.
questions.correctAnswer: Because they depend on the path taken during a process, not just the initial and final states.
questions.explanation: Heat and work are process-dependent quantities, unlike state functions which depend only on the current state.

questions.question: A system loses 50J of heat and has 20J of work done on it. What is the change in internal energy ΔU?
questions.explanation: ΔU = Q - W. Here Q = -50J (lost), W = -20J (done on system? carefully), so ΔU = -50 - (-20) = -30J

questions.question: Define a closed system.
questions.explanation: A closed system can exchange energy (heat/work) with surroundings but not matter.

questions.question: Which quantity is positive when heat is added to a system?
questions.explanation: Heat added to the system (Q) is considered positive according to the sign convention.
